texts.line: A network error has occurred. The network function has been turned off.
Enemies are weak, and you can equip auto-chips.
The standard, most enjoyable difficulty. Probably.
Battles are tougher and you can't use lock-on.
You can't use lock-on, and you will die in one hit.
Select a save file to load.
Select a save slot to save your progress to.
Select a save slot to begin a new game.
Offer a prayer over the body.
Cancel and return to the game screen.
View the map or perform a quick-save.
View or use items in your inventory.
View various types of acquired data.
Load game, save game, or change system settings.
Saving is disabled because the debug menu was used.
View the map in greater detail.
View a list of icons used on the map.
View quests that cannot be completed.
This function cannot be used at this time.
Install plug-in chips to enhance functionality.
View all of the weapons in your possession.
Change the weapons in Weapon Set 1.
Change the weapons in Weapon Set 2.
Change your weapon for light attacks.
Change your weapon for heavy attacks.
View information about encountered units and foes.
View tutorials that have been displayed in-game.
View information about fish you've caught.
Exit the game and return to the desktop.
Toggle ability to leave messages upon death.
Change the message left behind upon death.
View information about your online body.
Select chapter and start the game.
You cannot travel outside of the mission area.
"I don't want to go there right now."
Clear as many hacking games as you can.
Play hacking games you've already cleared.
These are your current play records.
Choose a part of your message to edit.

Restores 100% HP and cures all
status ailments.

Weapon attacks do double damage for
15 seconds.

Weapon attacks do double damage for
30 seconds.

Pod ranged attacks do double damage
for 15 seconds.

Pod ranged attacks do double damage
for 30 seconds.

Melee damage taken is reduced by
50% for 15 seconds.

Melee damage taken is reduced by
50% for 30 seconds.

Projectile damage taken is reduced by
50% for 15 seconds.

Projectile damage taken is reduced by
50% for 30 seconds.

Skill gauge replenishes twice as fast
for 15 seconds.

Skill gauge replenishes twice as fast
for 30 seconds.

Prevents staggering from an attack for
15 seconds.

Prevents staggering from an attack for
30 seconds.

Increases the power of 
weapon-based attacks 
by 50% for 30 seconds. 
Also restores 100% HP.
Give to an animal in order to ride them.

Enemies drop more money for
30 seconds.

Enemies drop more money for
60 seconds.

Disrupts auditory & visual feed for
30 seconds while generating other
random effects.
Skin acquired from a wild beast.

Meat procured from a boar.
Can be exchanged for money.

Meat procured from a moose.
Can be exchanged for money.

Meat from a white-furred wild boar.
Can be exchanged for money.

Meat from a white-furred moose.
Can be exchanged for money.

A piece of a meteorite that fell to
the earth.
The arm unit of a machine lifeform.
The leg unit of a machine lifeform.
The torso unit of a machine lifeform.
The head unit of a machine lifeform.

A gadget so simple you don't
know what it's for.

A gadget so elaborate you don't
know what it's for.

A gadget so complex you don't
know what it's for.
Use this to make your Pod stronger.
Use this to make your Pod stronger.
Use this to make your Pod stronger.
A chip with nothing saved on it.

Ore containing copper.
It's usually mined, but
for some reason, this stuff 
is lying around everywhere.

Mined ore containing iron. 
Iron can be extracted by heating 
it to 3000 degrees in a furnace.

Mined ore containing silver.
Human history states silver was
used to defeat demons, but
machines seem impervious.

Mined ore containing gold. Humans
treasured gold as a valuable mineral,
but to machines it's worthless.

A seed of some plant. Seems it would
be tricky to grow.

A sticky substance secreted from
tree stumps.
A seed fallen from a tree.

A rose that bloomed in the desert.
Can be exchanged for money.

A fungus that grows at the roots of
trees.
A book too worn to read.

A compound used when producing
leather.
Mined ore that sets off sparks when hit.

Mined ore. A semi-translucent jewel
created from petrified tree sap.

An elastic substance extracted from
plants.

A large pearl with a black luster. 
Extremely rare.

An earring worn by humans.
Can be exchanged for money.

A bracelet worn by humans.
Can be exchanged for money.
A socket to be used in a plug.

A choker used by humans.
Can be exchanged for money.

An old mask left behind by a 
machine lifeform.
Can be exchanged for money.

Earrings worn by humans.
Can be exchanged for money.

A tech manual written in letters you
can't understand.

A thick book thought to be 
a dictionary.
Mined ore. A beautiful green jewel.

A piece of meteor, fallen from outer
space.

A part obtained from a special
machine lifeform. 
Can be exchanged for money.

A letter addressed to Sartre that
seems to contain a question.
You shouldn't read it.

A letter addressed to Jean-Paul that
seems to contain a question.
You shouldn't read it.

Beautifully polished glass intended for
Sartre.

Beautifully polished glass intended for
Jean-Paul.

An old, rusty machine fossil intended
for Sartre.

An old, rusty machine fossil intended
for Jean-Paul.

Sartre's letter. It reads: 
"I've left to seek the truth of the world.
Throw that trash away!"

Jean-Paul's letter. It reads: 
"I've left to seek the truth of the world.
Throw that trash away!"

The bloodied memory chip of a
machine lifeform. Says its allies
were destroyed by the resistance.

A journal left behind by a man.
Thoughts about his fallen comrades are
spelled out within.

A chip containing a data log on A2.
Heavily damaged, there is little that
can be analyzed.

A chip containing a data log on A2.
Heavily damaged, there is little that
can be analyzed.

A chip containing a data log on A2.
Heavily damaged, there is little that
can be analyzed.

A chip containing a data log on A2.
Heavily damaged, there is little that
can be analyzed.

A chip containing a data log on A2.
Heavily damaged, there is little that
can be analyzed.
Dog tag of a member of the Resistance.
Dog tag of a member of the Resistance.
Dog tag of a member of the Resistance.
Dog tag of a member of the Resistance.

A rusted musical box that can no
longer play.
A restored photo. It's much clearer now.
A restored photo. It's much clearer now.
A restored photo. It's much clearer now.

A package that was kept in the
Resistance's materials storeroom.
The contents are unknown.

Created by humans, this broken toy
no longer works.

A book humans used for recording
family finances.

A small shoe thought to have been
worn by a human girl.

A cable with three colored connectors.
Used for creating games.

A cable with four colored connectors.
Used for creating games.

A cable with five colored connectors.
Used for creating games.

A tool humans used to brush their teeth.
Reduces the probability of cavities.

A cosmetic item humans would rub on
their lips to make themselves beautiful.

Used by humans to reduce fat levels
caused by consuming more energy
than necessary.

A tool for recording information.
Records indicate these were believed
to be mightier than swords.

A book of pharmaceuticals for living
organisms that already existed in the
Pod's database.

Unlocks a Tower sub-unit in the
Forest Kingdom.

Unlocks a Tower sub-unit in the
Flooded City.

Unlocks a Tower sub-unit in the
Amusement Park.

Part of a machine lifeform. May have
something to do with the treasure
of the forest.
A stamp from the amusement park.

A card used for collecting stamps at
the amusement park.

A slab with the laws of an ancient
country written upon it. Many of
them don't make any sense.

A weighty stone mask. It's as dirty as
it is heavy.
A statue in the shape of a young girl.

Necessary for restoring a machine
lifeform's memory banks.

A plug-in chip containing classified
information.

Taken from a plant with tough bark.
Necessary for creating a fuel filter.

Grants the bearer access to the
gambling arena.

A lost bag belonging to
the Resistance.

A key that unlocks an elevator in
the shopping mall.

A book of philosophy that Anemone
gave you. Its title means "thoughts"
in an ancient language.

A filter used by androids to refine
fuel.

High-viscosity oil used by machine
lifeforms.

This can be traded for a single
item at a shop.

A pouch that emits a scent animals
love. Prevents them from running
when approached.

A pouch that emits a scent animals
love. Lets you ride them anytime
you want.

A pouch that emits a scent animals
love. Causes them to approach and
wait for you.

Listen to nice BGM on the jukebox.
Part 1 of a set of 5.

Unlock more BGM on the jukebox.
Part 2 of a set of 5 amazing
soundtracks.

Unlock more BGM on the jukebox.
Part 3 of a set of 5 soundtracks 
in extremely high demand.

Unlock more BGM on the jukebox.
Part 4 of a set of 5 highly anticipated
soundtracks.

Unlock more BGM on the jukebox.
The final part in possibly the best 
soundtrack series ever.

Use this to change your costume.
Taking damage will not remove your 
clothes in any way.

[Equipment]
Protective armor formally issued
to YoRHa troops. 2B can equip this
costume.

[Equipment]
Protective armor formally issued
to YoRHa troops. 2B can equip this
costume.

[Accessory]
A head covering worn by machine
lifeforms.

[Accessory]
This head covering belongs to Emil.

[Accessory]
Emil gave you this wearable 
Lunar Tear.

[Accessory]
Glasses worn by Adam. Equip them
to instantly feel more intelligent.

[Accessory]
A mask of an alien face.

[Pod Skin]
Shaped after a common household
appliance vital for survival.

[Pod Model]
A high-capacity device used in the
Gestalt Project. It exudes a vague 
aura of pompousness.

[Pod Skin]
Shaped after a very sturdy box used
for transporting goods in the jungle.

[Pod Skin]
White and blue stripes with a dash
of pink. Common in the Far East.

[Pod Skin]
A retro Pod skin that looks like an
ancient device from the East.

[Pod Skin]
Make your Pod look like an
indestructible entertainment
device.

[Pod Skin]
A Pod skin powered by some kind
of ancient blast-based processing
technology.

[Pod Skin]
A super nostalgic four-color 
pattern on a bed of grey.

[Pod Skin]
A purple Pod skin filled with the
hopes and dreams of millions of
children.

[Accessory]
A valve-shaped accessory.
Use in left eye only.

[Accessory]
A valve-shaped accessory.
Use in right eye only.

[Accessory]
A valve-shaped accessory.
Can be equipped in both eyes.

[Accessory]
A valve-shaped accessory.
Can be equipped on your head.

[Accessory]
Goggles with so much camouflage
they became entirely invisible.

[Accessory]
A trendy pink ribbon with a simple
design. Popular among androids of
all ages.

[Accessory]
A cool blue ribbon with an elegant
design. Goes well with rough jackets.

The core of a machine lifeform
containing a copious amount of data. 
Can be exchanged for money.

The cores of children from Pascal's
village. It is clear they were cherished 
by the villagers.
Can be exchanged for money.

A book on life and death. It was
lying outside of Pascal's house,
in a thoroughly used state.
Can be exchanged for money.

Bare android fists are passable weapons, but it can be
difficult to land effective blows with them.

A blade once held by an attendant who cared deeply for 
his lord. Like his loyalty, its blade is unbent.

A rusty iron pipe covered in the vital fluids of machine
lifeforms.

A sword decorated with a bestial motif.
Short and thin, it easily goes unnoticed.

A ceremonial implement allegedly made from phoenix
feathers. Mostly decorative. Untested in combat.

Long ago, a cruel lord used this sword on his own
subjects in a vain attempt to attain immortality.

An advanced blade, issued to elite YoRHa on the
front lines. Its power increases with its charge.

A dated YoRHa blade trusted by android veterans.
Not the latest model, but proven in combat.

A white sword like those carried by samurai of
old. Looks flashy, but the blade is top quality.

A black oriental sword. Its no-frills
design gives it an aura of serious weaponry.

This common blade is a standard-issue weapon
given to all YoRHa troops.

An improvised blade used by machine lifeforms. It
may be made from scraps, but it gets the job done.

The blade is dull - Its power comes from mass alone.
Does it smell of iron, or is that human blood...?

A giant, cursed axe, anointed with the blood of
innocent twins to assuage the wrath of the gods.

Bearing a bestial design, this sword cuts down
any who would challenge its bearer's authority.

A sword allegedly made from phoenix feathers, used
by temple guards. As yet untested in combat.

An advanced YoRHa weapon designed to defeat giant
machine lifeforms. Its power increases with its charge.

A durable, older model YoRHa weapon, time-tested
and proven for turning machine lifeforms into scrap.

This samurai sword's pure white blade is not yet
sullied by a single drop of blood.

This warrior's sword has been stained jet black
with the blood of years of conflict.

Though cobbled together from scrap metal, this
machine lifeform's axe packs a terrifying punch.

Monks carried this decorative spear, said to be
made from phoenix feathers, on pilgrimages.

A spear emblazoned with a bestial motif, once used
by a lord to quell rebellion among his subjects.

A spear symbolic of the covenant between a
mighty warlord and an ancient dragon.

A prince's body double used this spear to slay his
liege, and met his own fate on the same edge.

YoRHa commanders' guards wield this advanced spear.
Its power increases as it charges with energy.

An old YoRHa spear, built to imitate ancient human
weaponry. Old-fashioned, but reliable.

This pure white spear shines with the pride
of the haughty samurai who once bore it.

Its pitch-black spearhead gleams with the
ruthlessness of a warrior who never knew mercy.

A spear used by machine lifeforms, specially
formed from scrap metal to destroy androids.

Weapons fashioned in parts unknown to resemble
the holy wings of angels.

Weapons fashioned in realms unseen to resemble
the unholy fangs of demons.

First introduced in A.D. 11940, these YoRHa knuckle
weapons become powerful with more energy.

These old YoRHa weapons have a crude but reliable
mechanism that imparts blows with explosive power.

Stark white samurai gauntlets, kept pristine.
Their master never saw a moment of conflict.

Samurai gauntlets worn by a commander infamous
for cruelty, blackened with the blood of his foes.

Fist weapons made from the heads of machines.
Though simple, they have notable power due to their mass.

A sword passed down and continuously improved among 
the royal family of a land where magic prospers.

A stick made of cypress wood. Can hardly be called 
a weapon, but somehow grants courage to its user.

Weapons shaped like Emil's head,  made of an unknown
singular element.

A sword wielded by a loyal
attendant.

A sword with the king of beasts
as its motif.

A ritual item made from the plume
of a phoenix.

A sword with a strange
and uncomfortable aura.

A white blade used by samurai
of the East.

A black blade used by warriors
of the East.

A sword wielded by machine
lifeforms.

A colossal axe offered unto the
gods.

A greatsword shaped after the
king of beasts.

A greatsword made from the plume
of a phoenix.

A white katana kept by samurai
of the East.

A black katana kept by warrior
monks of the East.
An axe used by machine lifeforms.

A spear made from the plume
of a phoenix.

A spear with the king of beasts
as its motif.

Symbol of the bond between a lord
and an old dragon.

A spear used by a prince's double
to murder his liege.

A white spear used by samurai
of the East.

A black spear used by warrior
monks of the East.
A spear used by machine lifeforms.

Weapons shaped after an angel's
holy wings.

Weapons shaped after a demon's
profane fangs.

Weapons made of white armor
from the East.

Weapons made of black armor
from the East.

Weapons made from machine
lifeforms' heads.

A magical blade used by a
royal family.
A stick made of cypress wood.

Unique weapons shaped like 
Emil's head.
Increases stun value dealt to enemies.
Grants a discount at the Resistance shops.
Grants a discount at the machine shops.
Adds a high probability of stunning enemies.
Adds a beast effect to close-range attacks.
Chance of restoring HP when damaging enemies.
Adds a shock wave when striking enemy projectiles.
Charges on standby. Increases Attack for a time.
Detonates the final hit of close-range combos.
Increases attack power when HP is full.
Increases attack power when HP is 30% or less.
Does more damage as you defeat enemies. (Max 500.)
Decreases chance of staggering from attacks.
Adds a shock wave when striking enemy projectiles.
Adds a beast effect to close-range attacks.
Chance of restoring HP when damaging enemies.
Charges on standby. Increases Attack for a time.
Detonates the final hit of close-range combos.
Increases attack power when HP is full.
Increases attack power when HP is 30% or less.
Does more damage as you defeat enemies. (Max 500.)
Chance of restoring HP when damaging enemies.
Adds a beast effect to close-range attacks.
Chance to subjugate foes when attacking them.
Charges on standby. Increases Attack for a time.
Detonates the final hit of close-range combos.
Increases attack power when HP is full.
Increases attack power when HP is 30% or less.
Does more damage as you defeat enemies. (Max 500.)
Restores HP when finishing off enemies.
Adds a shock wave when finishing off enemies.
Charges on standby. Increases Attack for a time.
Detonates the final hit of close-range combos.
Increases attack power when HP is full.
Increases attack power when HP is 30% or less.
Does more damage as you defeat enemies. (Max 500.)
Changes damage values and your evade maneuver.
Changes damage values and treasure chests.
Swing these weapons to hear Emil's voice!

Fires a powerful laser in the
direction that the Pod is facing.

Analyzes all enemies in a fixed
radius, allowing combatants to
deliver a series of deadly slashes
to all who are caught within.

Summons a mass of energy that
unleashes a devastating blow
upon its target.

Spins a Pod around the player at
high speed, wreaking havoc on
any enemies it touches.

Produces a mass of energy that
sprouts from the ground in the
shape of deadly spears.

Deploys a protective barrier that
blocks projectile attacks.

Deploys a protective barrier that
blocks melee attacks.

Generates a powerful shock wave
by slamming a Pod to the ground
from an elevated height.

Fires a wire in the direction that
the Pod is facing. If it hits a foe,
it launches the combatant right to
the target for an up-close assault.

Creates an image of the user,
drawing the attention of foes
and firing upon them with
the Pod's ranged attack.

Creates a field that distorts time,
slowing down all enemies that
enter its vicinity.

Emits a temporary beam 
capable of healing the 
combatants as long as they 
remain within its radius.

Throws a volley of small
explosive charges over a set
period of time.

Unleashes a blast that sucks in
any enemies in the vicinity.

Restrains and shocks one nearby
enemy, causing continuous
damage over a set period of time.

Allows a combatant to ride atop
a Pod—with a certain degree of
directional control—as it rushes
forward into the fray.

Emits ultrasonic waves to 
scan the surroundings 
in search of hidden items.
